result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laquandis M Cannon

records.addlTxt: Defendant here today at Collections window to apply for county appointed attorney - to return with completed Petition for Counsel, bring along SPD Financial Eligibility Worksheet and provide most recent paystub.
Status conference on December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:20 AM Defendant Laquandis M Cannon in court.  Prosecuting attorney Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant indicated they applied for SPD but did not qualify, has not applied for CDP, requested adjournment.
Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not be at Pawn America.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Riley M.
Trial Judge - Br 14

2:17 PM Defendant Laquandis M Cannon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Adam Matthias Welch in court for Laquandis M Cannon.  Prosecuting attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.
Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
